* The Leader of the Opposition criticised also an attitude which he believes the Government has to <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730314_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-28-0)

* We on this side of the House welcome <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730314_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-28-0)

* Successive Liberal-Country Party governments in previous years have a lot to answer for because of the way in which they treated <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730314_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-28-0)

* Far too many children of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> were given their schooling in areas where facilities and accommodation were inadequate and, in some cases, deplorable. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730314_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-28-0)

* I give the assurance to the  Deputy  Leader of the Opposition and to the House generally that this Government will take action to see to it that <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who come before our courts, are convicted and have records that put them within the provisions of deportation will not remain in our midst. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730327_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-4-0)

* As the  Deputy  Leader of the Opposition has raised the question of the status of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in our community, I place on record in this House that since World War II more than 3 million people have come to this country and the overwhelming majority of them have been great citizens. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730327_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-4-0)

* Is the Minister able to reconcile these instructions with claims by the Victorian Minister for Education that he realises English teaching to <span class="highlight">migrants</span> is of great importance to certain schools, particularly those in inner suburbs? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730327_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-20-0)

* It is understandable that some Yugoslav <span class="highlight">migrants</span> of Croatian origin should continue to hope for the establishment of an independent Croatia and within a democracy like Australia they have a right to advocate their views so long as they do so by legitimate means. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730327_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-42-0)

* I have reason to believe that the terrorists are endeavouring to create the impression amongst Yugoslav <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in Australia that the Croatian extremists have the support of significant sections of Australian society and even the government. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730327_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-42-0)

* We should not abandon our democratic principles of free speech, belief and association but I would hope that <span class="highlight">migrants</span> are left with no misunderstanding of the disfavour with which the Government would view  any activities which might reasonably give rise to objections by the present governments of their countries of origin. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730327_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-42-0)

* As a result of the timely action taken by the Minister for Immigration a service is now rendered to <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who are experiencing difficulties of communication in matters of urgency. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730328_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-14-0)

* The arrangements made involve a 24-hour telephone service and I am informed that <span class="highlight">migrants</span> generally are delighted with this facility. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730328_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-14-0)

* It is true that it would be more advantageous if this facility were brought to the notice of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> by having it inserted in an appropriate place in the directory and I undertake to see that this is done. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730328_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-14-0)

* Is the Minister aware that a considerable number of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> believe that a slur has been cast on the migrant community in general by the statement made on Tuesday by  Senator Murphy  and that many of them who are not yet naturalised are fearful for their safety? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730329_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-7-0)

* The position is that the greatest slur that has been cast on the migrant community in Australia has been cast upon it by the handful of people who have brought discredit on all of the community by their acts of violence and by their law breaking, and this is resented by the vast majority of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who resent being associated with people who are criminals. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730329_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-7-0)

* I had not only authorised, but directed, the Attorney-General from his first week in office to do what his predecessors conspicuously failed to do - to follow up departmental and ministerial reports on the growth of terrorist activities in Australia and the threat that they represented not only to all Australians but to <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in particular and to our relations with a country with which we have had unbroken relations since 1918 and of which we have been an ally in 2 wars. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730329_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-11-0)

* Yugoslav <span class="highlight">migrants</span> than in any other electorate in Australia, there are to be found club premises with, in a place of honour, photographs of Pavelic, the Ustasha flag- [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730329_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-13-0)

* It is an area which has attracted a large number of <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730329_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-25-0)

* The population of a division includes 'the children, <span class="highlight">migrants</span> and everybody in the area. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730329_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-25-0)

* By and large the inner-city seats contain the greatest number of <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730329_reps_28_hor82/#subdebate-25-0)

* Has the Minister for Labour noticed a statement by the head of his Department,  Mr Sharpe,  implying a clear criticism of the South Australian Government and South Australian Housing Trust for apparently making available homes to <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in Whyalla 10 days after their arrival, in comparison with a 12 to 16-week waiting time for unemployed South Australians from, say, Adelaide? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730403_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-19-0)

* It specifies, in effect, that the representations shall be in relation to the numbers of people; that is, the total population of the States including children, <span class="highlight">migrants</span> and - since 1967  -  Aborigines. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730403_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-29-0)

* I ask the Prime Minister the following question: In view of the McCarthy-like allegations made by him in  this place and by the Attorney-General in another place firstly against <span class="highlight">migrants</span> to Australia and now against individual public servants and his instigation of inquiries into, to use his words the 'possible malevolence and incompetence' of the latter, will the Prime Minister, if he cannot now open the inquiry to public scrutiny, undertake to table in this House the full result of his inquiry? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730404_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-15-0)

* The population of a division includes the children, <span class="highlight">migrants</span> and everybody in the area. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730404_reps_28_hor83/#debate-32)

* Members of this House do not represent only those electors who voted for them or even just the electors; they also represent those who do not have the vote those <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who have elected not to take out Australian citizenship and the thousands of children too young to vote. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730404_reps_28_hor83/#debate-32)

* Not in the country but in the city and rural-urban electorates - in places like Mount Druitt, in the electorate of Chifley, where 70 per cent are under 14 years and in my own electorate of La Trobe, which covers more than 1,000 square miles, with the second largest voting population in Victoria and with a fair percentage of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> and an above average population of pensioners and one-parent families. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730404_reps_28_hor83/#debate-32)

* Under these procedures, one of the five basic requirements to be met by <span class="highlight">migrants</span> is that they should have a sincere intention of making a permanent home in Australia, and joining the Australian family through citizenship. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730404_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-36-3)

* But we already know that <span class="highlight">migrants</span> contribute proportionately more to the workforce than they do to the population supported by that workforce, that they include a substantial proportion of skilled and other key workers, that the great majority receive all their educational and vocational training prior to coming here and, therefore, at no cost to Australia and that they contribute particularly to the maintenance and development of key industries and services. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730404_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-36-4)

* Even the costs of <span class="highlight">migrants</span>' assisted passages are offset, through taxation, within a short time of their arrival here. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730404_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-36-4)

* The Good Neighbour Council in each State and Territory will be encouraged to extend its affiliations with all agencies whose members and resources might provide assistance to <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in their neighbourhoods. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730404_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-36-6)

* This has afforded the opportunity for informal discussion with key members of the Good Neighbour Councils and representatives of ethnic organisations and other agencies with the aim of encouraging wider participation in the voluntary community work of assisting <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in their settlement. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730404_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-36-6)

* The mounting chain disclosed with ever greater certainty the fact that right wing organisations associated with certain Croatian <span class="highlight">migrants</span> to Australia were actively involved in terrorist activities. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730405_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-3-0)

* It is only by moving for a suspension of Standing Orders and by suggesting that members on this side of the House be permitted to make statements relative to the charges laid that we have and can have any opportunity at all to defend ourselves and to demonstrate to the people of Australia that, unlike the present regime, we pursued practices which pertained to the proper administration of the law which enabled individuals to rest secure in their own homes without the fear of police intervention in the wee small hours of the morning, without the fear of that knock on the door - the knock on the door that for so many was the genesis of their wishing to leave their former country to come to Australia, a fear to which now so many <span class="highlight">migrants</span> to this country must unfortunately be subject again. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730405_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-15-0)

* I represent, as I have said before, more <span class="highlight">migrants</span> from Yugoslavia than any honourable member in this House has represented, and I can assure honourable members that the use of the flag, the portrait and the celebration of the anniversary create just as much tension and resentment among <span class="highlight">migrants</span> from Yugoslavia as the display of Hitler's photograph and the display of the swastika flag would create among most people in Australia. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730405_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-15-0)

* lt comes in recognition of the special rights and needs of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in this country - justice too long denied them. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730405_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-21-0)

* For too long <span class="highlight">migrants</span> have been told by past governments of their valuable contribution to the development of this nation. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730405_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-21-0)

* But for equally long too little has been contributed by those governments towards the special needs of so many <span class="highlight">migrants</span> especially during their difficult period of adjusting to a new, alien and not always hospitable society. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730405_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-21-0)

* The presence of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in this country has been valuable to this nation and has given it and its people a far better future than would have been achieved otherwise. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730405_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-21-0)

* But there is much that should have been done to assist many <span class="highlight">migrants</span> and we intend remedying this neglect. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730405_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-21-0)

* While it will benefit mainly aged, invalid and widowed <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who wish to return to their former homelands, cither permanently or temporarily, it will apply equally to all pensioners. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730405_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-21-0)

* I have never supported the proposition that <span class="highlight">migrants</span> are in some way obliged to forget the affairs of their homelands - their ancestral homes. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-2-0)

* While I fully recognise and endorse the right of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in Australia to maintain their links with, and their interest in, the affairs of their former countries, I have to insist that such interest cannot be exercised in such a way as to distress other Australians. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-2-0)

* In particular, I wish to remove any grounds for discrimination in matters of citizenship and employment against <span class="highlight">migrants</span> or any section of any migrant community. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-2-0)

* We highly value the contribution made to Australia by most Croatian <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-2-0)

* Many <span class="highlight">migrants</span> remembered the 1930s. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-2-0)

* I have reason to believe that the terrorists are endeavouring to create the impression among Yugoslav <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in Australia that the Croatian extremists have the support of significant sections of Australian society and even the Government. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-2-0)

* Under the Migration Act, I have the authority, as Minister, to order the deportation of aliens and immigrants in certain defined circumstances. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-2-0)

* The special reports branch is not concerned only with offences by <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-2-0)

* It is equally concerned with offences which affect the interests of <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-2-0)

* There is today a genuine fear among those members of the Australian community who are <span class="highlight">migrants</span> to this country, particularly those who came from Eastern European countries, that those midnight and pre-dawn knocks on the door, which are reminiscent of the very reason for their leaving their own countries, are likely to be repeated in this country. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730410_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-4-0)

* After this period in Australia substantial numbers of fine <span class="highlight">migrants</span> have come to know Australia, feel settled here, want to identify themselves as members of our community and are in fact living as such without friction or problems. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-14-0)

* This means that <span class="highlight">migrants</span> from all the 31 Commonwealth countries will now have the same opportunity as other <span class="highlight">migrants</span> to take part in citizenship ceremonies suitably marking the important occasion of their becoming citizens. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-14-0)

* By these means, and by all other possible means, it is the Government's wish to ensure that our <span class="highlight">migrants</span> from Commonwealth countries are no longer ignored or left in the mistaken belief that they acquire our citizenship automatically and that the rest of the Australian community attaches no importance to their becoming citizens. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-14-0)

* We intend to demonstrate that beyond any shadow of doubt, and warmly welcome all <span class="highlight">migrants</span> without distinction. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-14-0)

* Again this seeks to remove a condition of granting citizenship that burdened some of our <span class="highlight">migrants</span> more than others. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-14-0)

* But in fact, of course, the legislation covers a large number of <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* Between them those countries account for a large number of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> to Australia. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* At the same time the Opposition wishes to protect the interests of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> and indeed all Australians in achieving true portability of pensions. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* People are concerned about the doubtful position which British <span class="highlight">migrants</span> occupy at present. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* In fact, most <span class="highlight">migrants</span> - not all, but most - were covered. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* In respect of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> from Italy, Malta, Greece and Turkey we were covered by agreements negotiated under the new legislation. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* We all want a fair thing to be done to the <span class="highlight">migrants</span> that come to Australia, whether they come from the United Kingdom or from Europe or wherever it may be. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* The migrant community should be treated fairly, but if <span class="highlight">migrants</span> require over-generous treatment, in the short term they may get advantage and the Australian Labor Party may get votes, but over the long term that is not to the advantage of the groups in the migrant community. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* I do not know whether honourable members - 1 am speaking now not of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> but of Aborigines - saw recently on television a backlash from towns in the Northern Territory about what was being done for our Aborigines. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* For the <span class="highlight">migrants</span> also I say this: A fair go is what they are entitled to and what we should give them, but we should be very careful that we are not opening the Australian Treasury to plunder - not by the <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who are here; they are not the people I am talking about at all. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* This we do not want, and if these carpet baggers come from overseas to Australia for this purpose they will be doing things which are to the disadvantage of those good <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who are now in Australia, whom we want to help and who are entitled to fair deals. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* Secondly, it is a further development in our review of the migration system and of the official attitude to <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* Under the reciprocal arrangements made with the 4 countries I have mentioned, a considerable number of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> are already covered. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* I notice from the most recent consolidated statistics of the Department of Immigration that for the period 1945 to 1972 inclusive the numbers of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> regarded as permanent  and long term arrivals, by country of last residence, are as follows: Greece  210,000,  Italy  404,000. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* As will be seen, the reciprocal arrangements cover in general terms - I know that this is not a strictly accurate representation of the cover available -  703,000  <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* But this leaves an enormous number of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> uncovered in the event that they wish to return to their original countries of residence. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* In the same table in the Department's consolidated statistics covering the same period, that is  1945  to  1972  inclusive, we find the following numbers of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> regarded as permanent and long term arrivals, by country of last residence: The United Arab Republic  32,000,  South Africa  24,000,  Canada  53,000,  United States of America  124,000,  Ceylon  12,000,  Cyprus  17,000,  Hong Kong  26,000,  India,  37.000,  Malaysia  54,000,  Singapore  24,000. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* I remind the House that I am comparing them with the number of  703,000  <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who would be covered under existing reciprocal arrangements if they returned to their countries of origin. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* 1  do not want to delay the House, but I think that for the sake of completeness it would be worthwhile to put into the record a list of the numbers of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> from some other countries. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* I have omitted those countries with fewer than  10,000  <span class="highlight">migrants</span> in the period I have mentioned. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* but they come to well over one million <span class="highlight">migrants</span> coming from countries with which we have no reciprocal agreement and in respect of which the possibility of reaching a reciprocal agreement in some cases is nebulous and in other cases non-existent. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* If the <span class="highlight">migrants</span> wished to return to their countries of origin or indeed to any other country other than the  4  with which we already have agreements, they would be left out in the cold. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* I represent an area which has numerous <span class="highlight">migrants</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* This sort of situation occurs particularly in mining communities which have a great number of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> and this provision of the Bill will be particularly appreciated by them. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* In a debate which concerns the transferability of pensions to other countries we might refer perhaps to some of the unique and special difficulties of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who live in unusual places, such as the numerous <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who live in the city of Mt Isa which is my headquarters in Queensland. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* People often ask: Why the blazes do <span class="highlight">migrants</span> not get away from the major cities? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1973/19730411_reps_28_hor83/#subdebate-20-0)

* These kinds of facilities that we are building up will be built into the system to that extent and will be available for the assistance of <span class="highlight">migrants</span> who come to this country.
